history.content:
I'm assuming this is for LS CS (and this applies only for students graduating Fall 2017 or earlier). If you're taking one of the alternative courses to fulfill the EE 16A requirement, that course will only count for EE 16A and cannot double-count for other major requirements.

Basically, the number of units required for the major stays the same:

  • 4 units of EE 16A (or alternative)
  • 27 units of Upper division:
    • 4 units of CS/EE Design
    • 8 units of CS Upper Divs 
    • 8 units of CS or EE Upper div
    • 7 units of tech electives

If it's an upper div class, of course those units can still count toward L&S unit requirements: 36 upper div units or the 6 non-major upper div units.
Can we use the same course to replace EE 16A and count towards an upper div elective requirement? Or only one requirement can be met?
history.subject: EE 16A Replacement Course Used as Electives
